Indicator: Quarterly Greenhouse Gas (GHG) Air Emissions Accounts
Description: Quarterly greenhouse gas emissions by activity and by region.
Disclaimer: The estimates are considered experimental. The sources and methods used to compile these estimates are still in development. Users are encouraged to examine the documentation, metadata, and sources associated with the data. User feedback on the fit-for-use of this product and whether the various dimensions of the product are appropriate is welcome.

Indicator: Annual Greenhouse Gas (GHG) Air Emissions Accounts
Description: Annual greenhouse gas emissions by activity and by region.
Disclaimer: Users are encouraged to examine the documentation, metadata, and sources associated with the data. User feedback on the fit-for-use of this product and whether the various dimensions of the product are appropriate is welcome.

Indicator: National Greenhouse Gas Emissions Inventories and Implied National Mitigation (Nationally Determined Contributions) Targets
Description: National Greenhouse Gas Emissions Inventories by the sector of origin and National Mitigation Targets as determined by the countries.
Disclaimer: The IMF Staff estimates (e.g. Business as Usual Estimates, Emissions Targets) are considered experimental. The sources and methods used to compile these estimates are still in development. Users are encouraged to examine the documentation, metadata, and sources associated with the data. User feedback on the fit-for-use of this product and whether the various dimensions of the product are appropriate is welcome.

Indicator: CO₂ Emissions, Emissions Intensities, and Emissions Multipliers
Description: CO₂ emissions;  CO₂ direct and indirect emissions per unit of output by industry and by country. CO₂ emissions by industry, in aggregate terms and in terms of output by industry.
Disclaimer: Users are encouraged to examine the documentation, metadata, and sources associated with the data. User feedback on the fit-for-use of this product and whether the various dimensions of the product are appropriate is welcome.

Indicator: CO₂ Emissions embodied in Domestic Final Demand, Production, and Trade
Description: Amount of CO₂ emissions from fuel combustion embodied in domestic final demand, production, and trade.
Disclaimer: Users are encouraged to examine the documentation, metadata, and sources associated with the data. User feedback on the fit-for-use of this product and whether the various dimensions of the product are appropriate is welcome.

Description: Carbon emissions associated with domestic output used for gross fixed capital formation financed by direct investment and its ratio to final demand. Carbon emissions embodied in the output of domestic and foreign owned enterprises and the emissions embodied in the portion of this output that is exported.
A tax whose tax base is a physical unit (or a proxy of it) of something that has a proven, specific, negative impact on the environment.

Government expenditures on a specified set of activities including pollution abatement, protection of biodiversity landscape, waste and wastewater management, within the framework of the Classification of Functions of Government (COFOG).
The extent to which fossil fuel prices paid by consumers do not reflect the fuels’ full financial and social costs, expressed as an aggregate value for each fuel and economy.
Disclaimer: The subsidy amounts are estimates using the available data. See the associated Working Paper for additional caveats.

Description: Electricity generation and electricity installed capacity, classified by energy type (renewable and non-renewable) and 10 technology types.

Indicator: Trade in Low Carbon Technology Products
Description: Low carbon technology products produce less pollution than their traditional energy counterparts, and will play a vital role in the transition to a low carbon economy. Low carbon technologies include mechanics like wind turbines, solar panels, biomass systems and carbon capture equipment.

Indicator: Bilateral Trade in Low Carbon Technology Products
Description: Bilateral trade flows of low carbon technology products.
Carbon sequestration is essential to mitigate global climate change. Forest ecosystems determine global climate change by removing or adding greenhouse gases such as CO2 from the atmosphere.
Disclaimer: Users are encouraged to examine the documentation, metadata, and sources associated with the data. User feedback on the fit-for-use of this product and whether the various dimensions of the product are appropriate is welcome.

Description: Trend in number of climate related natural disasters.

Climate-driven INFORM Risk Indicator helps assess risk for climate-driven hazards. It can support decisions about prevention, preparedness, and response. It has three dimensions: climate-driven hazard & exposure, vulnerability, and lack of coping capacity.

The ND-GAIN index is a global free open-source index, that measures a country’s current vulnerability to climate disruptions and assesses a country's readiness to leverage private and public sector investment for adaptive actions.
A selection and visualization of key indicators from the Network for Greening the Financial System (NGFS) climate scenarios. It is curated by the IMF in collaboration with the NGFS.
GDP losses from chronic risks and potential benefits from avoiding physical damages.

Indicator: Carbon Tax to Revenues/Assets in Disclosing Firms
Description: Carbon taxes are one of the leading policy tools being considered to incentivize a transition to a low-carbon economy. Carbon Cost to Revenues/Assets indicators give an indication of how high these taxes will be in alternative policy scenarios in comparison to revenues/assets of the disclosing firms, along the transition to 2050.
Copyright_and_Usage: The indicators are created from ICE Data Services and per license agreement they should not be used for commercial purposes; https://www.imf.org/external/terms.htm

Indicator: Revenues/Assets at Risk in Disclosing Firms
Description: Carbon taxes are one of the leading policy tools being considered to incentivize a transition to a low-carbon economy. Revenues/Assets at risk indicator shows the share of firms that are expected to be severely impacted by the assumed transition scenarios.
Copyright_and_Usage: The indicators are created from ICE Data Services and per license agreement they should not be used for commercial purposes; https://www.imf.org/external/terms.htm

Description: Green Bonds are any type of self-labelled fixed income instruments where the proceeds will be exclusively directed to finance or re-finance, in part or in full, new and/or existing green projects. It is regarded as a climate mitigation and adaptation tool.
Bank loans provide finance to industries with varying degrees of carbon intensities. The footprint of bank loans contributes to the disclosure of the carbon intensity of the loans portfolio.
Annual estimates of mean surface temperature change are measured with respect to a baseline climatology, corresponding to the period 1951-1980.
Disclaimer: Users are encouraged to examine the documentation, metadata, and sources associated with the data. User feedback on the fit-for-use of this product and whether the various dimensions of the product are appropriate is welcome.

Description: Monthly Atmospheric Carbon Dioxide concentrations.
Disclaimer:
The Mauna Loa data are being obtained at an altitude of 3400 m in the northern subtropics, and may not be the same as [the globally averaged CO₂ concentration at the surface](https://gml.noaa.gov/ccgg/trends/global.html#global).
Users are encouraged to examine the documentation, metadata, and sources associated with the data. User feedback on the fit-for-use of this product and whether the various dimensions of the product are appropriate is welcome.

Description: Change in mean sea levels in regions across the world.
Disclaimer: Users are encouraged to examine the documentation, metadata, and sources associated with the data. User feedback on the fit-for-use of this product and whether the various dimensions of the product are appropriate is welcome.

Description: Changes in land cover over time, grouping land cover into those types that have climate influencing, climate regulating and climate neutral impacts.
Disclaimer: Users are encouraged to examine the documentation, metadata, and sources associated with the data. User feedback on the fit-for-use of this product and whether the various dimensions of the product are appropriate is welcome.
